title: maxist23
author: maxist23
content: Good day everyone.Introducing an easy-to-use and very useful online account monitoring service for crypto exchanges.With it, you can track the status of your account or group of accounts almost on the go. Balance, drawdown, open pairs, ROE for them, statistics for the day, week, month. And all this with a delay of 1 to 5 seconds, that is, essentially online.Various types of reports and the possibility of modeling them, ease of registration (only keys are needed for reading), tariffs for every taste and wallet, there is also a free use, the possibility of freezing, a bonus program, a conscientious tech. support 24/7.So far, only futures. And only Binance and ByBit.In the near future: spot, other exchanges, a media section for a visual and as simple as possible display of trading results, storing history on our servers and its various analytics.Welcome to crmonitor.onlineOur cool display:https://crmonitor.online/cdn/files/crm-02.jpg

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Not sure if I can trust all these online tools that need one to enter an API and secret key anymoreThere was this Binance - 3commas incident that made me even more paranoid Binance Accounts Exploited Due To 3Commas API Key Hack3commas has been a reputable and one of the popular crypto trading bot until, well, shit happened, and some user data leaked from their side and some people lost money.

comments.author: maxist23
comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on January 30, 2023, 11:01:44 PMNot sure if I can trust all these online tools that need one to enter an API and secret key anymoreThere was this Binance - 3commas incident that made me even more paranoid Binance Accounts Exploited Due To 3Commas API Key Hack3commas has been a reputable and one of the popular crypto trading bot until, well, shit happened, and some user data leaked from their side and some people lost money.I understand your concerns. But our service is not trading, but informational and analytical. We only request read keys for registering accounts. It is simply impossible to make any trading operations, transfers of funds using these keys ... even if we are hacked

comments.author: tygeade
comments.body: Quote from: maxist23 on January 30, 2023, 11:14:30 PMWe only request read keys for registering accounts.Quote from: maxist23 on January 30, 2023, 06:37:40 PMease of registration (only keys are needed for reading)Where I can find such read-ONLY keys in my exchange account? I hold binance account but not sure what you are referring to, except API setup.Probably if your tool list out similar things in a single screen then that might be useful for high volume traders. As of now, I use mobile app to track my open orders on the go and I am active at only one exchange.

comments.author: maxist23
comments.body: Quote from: tygeade on January 31, 2023, 03:26:55 AMWhere I can find such read-ONLY keys in my exchange account? I hold binance account but not sure what you are referring to, except API setup.Probably if your tool list out similar things in a single screen then that might be useful for high volume traders. As of now, I use mobile app to track my open orders on the go and I am active at only one exchange. To create a read-only API key, you need to set the ☑️ Enable Reading checkbox at the stage of creating a key on the Binance exchangeAnswering the second question, of course, everyone chooses what is more convenient for him. In the Binance mobile app, for example, you can also track transactions and account status. But in our application, everything is on one screen, you don’t need to scroll anything, you can customize reports. It is more convenient in our opinion.Plus, as I said above, soon we will save trading data and make reports that are not available on binance ... for example, on income for a week, month, year. Let's make convenient charts and presentations

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: Quote from: maxist23 on January 31, 2023, 07:52:58 AMTo create a read-only API key, you need to set the ☑️ Enable Reading checkbox at the stage of creating a key on the Binance exchangeI checked your website and it seems like you only have a Binance guide for API setup for now. Would be a good idea to add guides for other exchanges as well, since some of them don't have a concise guide on how to set up a read-only API key. That being said though, nobody should rely on one guide published by a third party and try to check out their exchange themselves.Is your UI design final btw? I don't know how or why but I feel like it is not modern enough these days. The color scheme also doesn't really suit my taste. Not sure if it is a personal preference or not, but it is probably a good idea to do a review campaign or something similar if you're planning to improve your app further.

comments.author: tbct_mt2
comments.body: If it is for monitoring profit/ loss of my portfolio, I don't want to leak my API keys that can be compromised to drain out my account.Monitoring tools are for people with too big capital and too diversifying portfolio. If you have a portfolio with only a few coins inside, you can simply make your spreadsheet to monitor it.Coingecko has Portfolio trackerCoinmarketcap has its portfolio tracker too.On forum, RickDeckard has Portfolio Performance [Open Source] - Keep track of your Crypto Portfolio!
